title: Subspace sum; bases for a left module

blocks.name: clbs
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the set of bases for a vector space.
blocks.origin: const class clbs { LBasis }

blocks.name: diff.clbs.s
diff.clbs.c
diff.clbs.w
df-lbs
blocks.content: Define the set of bases to a left module or left vector space. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Jun-2014.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-lbs(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  |- wceq(clbs, cmpt(s0, universe, crab(s1, cpw(cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wsbc(s2, cfv(clspn, cv(s0)), wsbc(s3, cfv(csca, cv(s0)), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s1)), cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wral(s4, cv(s1), wral(s5, cdif(cfv(cbs, cv(s3)), csn(cfv(c0g, cv(s3)))), wn(wcel(co(cv(s5), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), cv(s4)), cfv(cv(s2), cdif(cv(s1), csn(cv(s4))))))))))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
}

axiom df-lbs(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  ‚ä¢ LBasis =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s1 ‚àà P((Base ` s0))|[(LSpan ` s0)/ s2][(Scalar ` s0)/ s3]((s2 ` s1)=(Base ` s0)‚àß ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà s1, ‚àÄ(s5 ‚àà((Base ` s3)\ {(0 ` s3)}), ¬¨(s5[(√ó ` s0)]s4)‚àà(s2 `(s1 \ { s4 })))))})

blocks.name: islbs
blocks.content: The predicate " ` B ` is a basis for the left module or vector space ` W ` ". A subset of the base set is a basis if zero is not in the set, it spans the set, and no nonzero multiple of an element of the basis is in the span of the rest of the family. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Jun-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: lsmelval2
blocks.content: Subspace sum membership in terms of a sum of 1-dim subspaces (atoms), which can be useful for treating subspaces as projective lattice elements. (Contributed by NM, 9-Aug-2014.)

blocks.name: lsmelpr

thm lsmelpr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {

blocks.name: lspvadd
blocks.content: The span of a vector sum is included in the span of its arguments. (Contributed by NM, 22-Feb-2014.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 21-Jun-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm lspvadd(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wss(cfv(c4, csn(co(c1, c5, c3))), cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3))))

  -| wceq(c4, cfv(clspn, c0))
} = {
  lspsnel5a(c4, co(c1, c5, c3), cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3)), cfv(clss, c0), c0, w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)))
  syl21anc(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c5, c3), cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3))), wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3)), cfv(clss, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3))), wcel(c3, cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3)))))
  syl2anc(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3)), cfv(clss, c0)), wcel(c0, clmod), wss(cpr(c1, c3), c2))
  lspcl(c0, cpr(c1, c3), c2, c4, cfv(clss, c0))
  mpbird(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wa(wcel(c1, cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3))), wcel(c3, cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3)))), wss(cpr(c1, c3), cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3))))
  syl2anc(w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wss(cpr(c1, c3), cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3))), wcel(c0, clmod), wss(cpr(c1, c3), c2))
  simp1(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2))
  3adant1(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wss(cpr(c1, c3), c2))
  prssi(c1, c2, c3)
  lspssid(c0, cpr(c1, c3), c2, c4)
  3adant1(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wb(wa(wcel(c1, cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3))), wcel(c3, cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3)))), wss(cpr(c1, c3), cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3)))))
  prssg(c1, c2, c3, c2, cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3)))
  lssvacl(c0, cfv(c4, cpr(c1, c3)), cfv(clss, c0), c1, c3, c5)
  eqid(cfv(clss, c0))

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà LMod ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2)‚Üí(c4 ` {(c1[c5]c3)})‚äÜ(c4 ` { c1, c3 }))

  ‚ä£ c5 =(+ ` c0)

  syl2anc((c0 ‚àà LMod ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2), { c1, c3 } ‚äÜ(c4 ` { c1, c3 }), c0 ‚àà LMod, { c1, c3 } ‚äÜ c2)
  simp1(c0 ‚àà LMod, c1 ‚àà c2, c3 ‚àà c2)
  3adant1(c0 ‚àà LMod, c1 ‚àà c2, c3 ‚àà c2, { c1, c3 } ‚äÜ c2)
  prssi(c1, c2, c3)
  lspssid(c0, { c1, c3 }, c2, c4)
  3adant1(c0 ‚àà LMod, c1 ‚àà c2, c3 ‚àà c2, ((c1 ‚àà(c4 ` { c1, c3 })‚àß c3 ‚àà(c4 ` { c1, c3 }))‚Üî { c1, c3 } ‚äÜ(c4 ` { c1, c3 })))
  prssg(c1, c2, c3, c2, (c4 ` { c1, c3 }))
  lssvacl(c0, (c4 ` { c1, c3 }), (LSubSp ` c0), c1, c3, c5)

thm lspsntrim(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(csg, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(clsm, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(clspn, c0))
} = {
  3sstr4d(cfv(c4, csn(co(c1, c5, c3))), co(cfv(c4, csn(c1)), c6, cfv(c4, csn(c3))), cfv(c4, csn(co(c1, cfv(cplusg, c0), cfv(cfv(cminusg, c0), c3)))), co(cfv(c4, csn(c1)), c6, cfv(c4, csn(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c0), c3)))), w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)))
  syld3an3(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wss(cfv(c4, csn(co(c1, cfv(cplusg, c0), cfv(cfv(cminusg, c0), c3)))), co(cfv(c4, csn(c1)), c6, cfv(c4, csn(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c0), c3))))), wcel(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c0), c3), c2))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c0), c3), c2))
  lmodvnegcl(c0, c3, c2, cfv(cminusg, c0))
  lspsntri(c0, c1, c2, cfv(cfv(cminusg, c0), c3), c4, cfv(cplusg, c0), c6)
  3adant1(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wceq(cfv(c4, csn(co(c1, c5, c3))), cfv(c4, csn(co(c1, cfv(cplusg, c0), cfv(cfv(cminusg, c0), c3))))))
  fveq2d(c4, csn(co(c1, c5, c3)), csn(co(c1, cfv(cplusg, c0), cfv(cfv(cminusg, c0), c3))), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)))
  sneqd(co(c1, c5, c3), co(c1, cfv(cplusg, c0), cfv(cfv(cminusg, c0), c3)), wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)))
  grpsubval(c1, c2, c3, c5, cfv(cplusg, c0), cfv(cminusg, c0), c0)

  oveq2d(cfv(c4, csn(c1)), c6, cfv(c4, csn(c3)), cfv(c4, csn(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c0), c3))), w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)))
  eqcomd(cfv(c4, csn(c3)), cfv(c4, csn(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c0), c3))), w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)))

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà LMod ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2)‚Üí(c4 ` {(c1[c5]c3)})‚äÜ((c4 ` { c1 })[c6](c4 ` { c3 })))

blocks.name: lbspropd
blocks.content: If two structures have the same components (properties), they have the same set of bases. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: pj1lmhm2
blocks.content: The left projection function is a linear operator. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 21-Apr-2016.)

thm pj1lmhm2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(co(c0, c1, c2), co(co(c3, cress, co(c0, c4, c2)), clmhm, co(c3, cress, c0))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(clss, c3))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(clsm, c3))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(c0g, c3))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cpj1, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, clmod))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cin(c0, c2), csn(c6)))
} = {
  mpbid(w0, wcel(co(c0, c1, c2), co(co(c3, cress, co(c0, c4, c2)), clmhm, co(c3, cress, c0))), wcel(co(c0, c1, c2), co(co(c3, cress, co(c0, c4, c2)), clmhm, c3)))
  pj1lmhm(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, w0)
  syl3anc(w0, wb(wcel(co(c0, c1, c2), co(co(c3, cress, co(c0, c4, c2)), clmhm, c3)), wcel(co(c0, c1, c2), co(co(c3, cress, co(c0, c4, c2)), clmhm, co(c3, cress, c0)))), wcel(c3, clmod), wcel(c0, c5), wss(crn(co(c0, c1, c2)), c0))
  frnd(co(c0, c1, c2), c0, co(c0, c4, c2), w0)
  pj1f(c0, c1, c2, c4, cfv(cplusg, c3), c3, c6, cfv(ccntz, c3), w0)
  eqid(cfv(cplusg, c3))
  ablcntzd(c0, cfv(ccntz, c3), c2, c3, w0)
  eqid(cfv(ccntz, c3))
  syl(w0, wcel(c3, cabl), wcel(c3, clmod))
  lmodabl(c3)
  sseldd(c0, cfv(csubg, c3), c5, w0)
  sseldd(c2, cfv(csubg, c3), c5, w0)
  syl(w0, wss(c5, cfv(csubg, c3)), wcel(c3, clmod))
  lsssssubg(c3, c5)
  reslmhm2b(c3, c0, c5, co(c0, c1, c2), co(c3, cress, co(c0, c4, c2)), co(c3, cress, c0))
